TitleSelect: School Life: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring School Life: From Rules to Activities"
ListenList: Are you allowed to eat in the classrooms?
Maria says eating in classrooms is not allowed.
John thinks it's okay to have snacks quietly.
Anna prefers eating only during breaks.
Are you allowed to smoke in the classrooms?
Maria says smoking is strictly forbidden.
John believes smoking should be allowed outside only.
Anna thinks smoking should be banned on school premises.
Did you belong to any clubs in high school?
Maria was in the science club.
John joined the soccer team.
Anna participated in the drama club.
Did you go to a public high school or a private one? What are the advantages of each type of school? Which type of school did you want to go to?
Maria went to a public school and appreciated the diversity.
John attended a private school and liked the smaller classes.
Anna preferred public school for its wide range of activities.
Did you have to wear a uniform in high school? How about elementary school?
Maria wore a uniform in both high school and elementary school.
John only wore a uniform in high school.
Anna never had to wear a uniform.
Did you study art in high school?
Maria enjoyed studying art and took several classes.
John did not take art classes.
Anna took one art class and found it interesting.
Did your high school have a band? If so, did you play in it? What instrument would you like to play in a high school band? Why?
Maria's school had a band, but she didn't play in it.
John played the drums in the band.
Anna would have liked to play the guitar in the band.
Do most of your teachers take attendance?
Maria says all her teachers take attendance.
John says some of his teachers are lenient about attendance.
Anna believes taking attendance is important for class management.
Do some of your teachers let class out early? What do you think when the teacher lets the class out early?
Maria likes it when class ends early as it gives her extra study time.
John thinks letting class out early is a waste of time.
Anna enjoys the extra free time when class ends early.

Do you carry a dictionary to your English classes? How about your other classes? Do you have an electronic dictionary? Can you and do you access your cellphone dictionary to find the meaning of a word?
Maria uses an electronic dictionary for all her classes.
John prefers using a cellphone dictionary.
Anna carries a traditional dictionary for her English class.
Do you enjoy studying English? Math? Science? Art? Biology? Chemistry?
Maria enjoys studying English and Biology.
John likes Math and Science the most.
Anna prefers Art and Chemistry.
Do you ever skip class?
Maria never skips class.
John occasionally skips class if he feels it's not important.
Anna sometimes skips class for extracurricular activities.
Do you have any evening classes?
Maria has evening classes twice a week.
John does not have any evening classes.
Anna has evening classes during the exam period.
Do you play on any of the school's sports teams?
Maria plays on the volleyball team.
John is a member of the soccer team.
Anna does not play on any sports teams.
Do you still keep in touch with your best friend in elementary school?
Maria is still in touch with her best friend from elementary school.
John lost contact with his elementary school friends.
Anna occasionally talks to her best friend from elementary school.
Have you ever been absent?
Maria has been absent a few times due to illness.
John rarely gets absent.
Anna has been absent for family trips.
Have you ever been late for class? If so, why? When was the last time? Did the teacher get angry?
Maria was late once due to a traffic jam, and the teacher was understanding.
John was late often and teachers usually got angry.
Anna was late because of a doctor's appointment, and the teacher was fine with it.
Have you ever failed a class? (Maybe this is not polite to ask.)
Maria has never failed a class.
John failed a math class once.
Anna struggled with chemistry but managed to pass.
Have you ever slept in class?
Maria has never slept in class.
John has slept in class a few times.
Anna tries not to sleep in class but has dozed off once.
How do you usually come here? How do you get to school?
Maria takes the bus to school.
John rides his bike.
Anna walks to school as she lives nearby.

seo.Topic: School Life: Rules, Activities, and Experiences
seo.Title: Exploring School Life: From Rules to Activities
seo.metaTitle: School Life: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring School Life: From Rules to Activities"
seo.metaDescription: Dive into the world of school life, exploring rules, activities, and experiences that shape the educational journey. Learn about the importance of school activities and the impact of school rules on students.

contentArray.content: Exploring School Life: From Rules to Activities

Understanding school life is essential for recognizing the importance of educational rules and activities. Schools have various policies like dress codes and attendance requirements that shape the daily experiences of students. Additionally, participating in clubs, sports, and other activities enriches students' lives, providing them with valuable skills and friendships.
